channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China's exports and imports grew far less than expected in September
item.description: China was expected Monday to report a slowdown in export growth in September versus August.

item.title: Earnings Watch: Netflix results are due. Wall Street wants it to raise prices
Bull market turns 2. Why fewer Fed rate cuts won’t rattle stock investors.
UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer vows to slash regulatory red tape in bid to boost investment
item.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Monday vowed to slash regulatory red tape to boost anaemic investment in the country.

item.title: Nobel economics prize for 2024 awarded to Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson and James Robinson
item.description: The winner of the award, officially the "Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel," receives $1 million.

item.title: Hurricanes Helene, Milton walloped parts of the U.S. What will they do to GDP?
Wells Fargo upgrades Flutter Entertainment, says buy the dip on the FanDuel parent stock
item.description: Investors should snatch up shares of Flutter Entertainment following a recent sell-off, according to Wells Fargo.

item.title: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer vows to ‘rip out the bureaucracy that blocks investment’
item.description: Starmer will be hosting a London summit aimed at securing much-needed funds.

item.title: European carmakers descend on Paris to showcase low-cost EVs
item.description: The show could mark a turning point for Europe’s automakers, which have struggled to produce cheap EVs.

item.title: Biden, surveying Milton's aftermath, announces $600M for rebuilding in Florida and other states
item.description: The Biden administration has sought to combat misinformation from former President Donald Trump and others about the emergency funds flowing to the st...

item.title: ECB expected to lower interest rates once again as inflation in the eurozone fades
item.description: Inflation fell to 1.8% in September, the first time it has been below the ECB's target of 2% since 2021.

item.title: Italy’s deputy PM says Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares should be ‘ashamed and apologise’ for ‘mismanaging an historic Italian company’
item.description: Tensions between the government and Stellantis escalate amid a row over automobile production costs and incentives in Italy.

item.title: China shares rise on vague stimulus news while Europe’s luxury brands take a hit
item.description: Shares in mainland China rose as investors digested Beijing's Saturday briefing on stimulus measures—in which the finance minister said more was neede...

item.title: Rule of law vital for national economic growth, Nobel laureates highlight
Hang Seng closes lower after China press conference on fiscal stimulus
